intro: Alyssum bertolonii f. ramosum, commonly known as the branched alyssum, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other well-known flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. Its foliage is typically covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Alyssum bertolonii f. ramosum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive blooms and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
